media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs ECHR judge selected after controversial procedure
media:group.media:description:
üìç The Council of Europe elected Vahe Grigoryan as Armenia's new judge in the European Court of Human Rights. The domestic selection procedure was marred by the lack of transparency and other issues. üìç Azerbaijan reiterates its demand for an unrestricted corridor through Armenia without any customs inspections. üìç Discontent: Prime Minister‚Äôs Discussion with Community- https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/814232/discontent-prime-ministers-discussion-with-community

entry.title: Pashinyan accused of questioning Armenian Genocide

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan accused of questioning Armenian Genocide
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan sparked outrage with statements that appeared to question aspects of the Armenian Genocide. üìç Armenia's major strategy focuses on preventing a war with Azerbaijan; the Armenian government is optimistic about the ongoing border delimitation process and no critical infrastructure will be ceded to Baku, Pashinyan said. üìç Deputy Foreign Minister of Armenia Vahan Kostanyan is on a visit to Syria, where he met with the country‚Äôs newly appointed Foreign Minister. üìç Young Syrian Armenians in Yerevan: Assad has fallen, what next: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/814032/young-syrian-armenians-in-yerevan-assad-has-fallen-what-next/

media:group.media:title: Russia and Iran sanctions limit Armenia‚Äôs economy, intelligence officials warn:THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç The World Bank Group approved a new strategy with around $1.2-$1.7 billion over the next five years to support sustainable economic development in Armenia. üìç International sanctions on Russia and Iran limit Armenia‚Äôs economic growth potential, according to Armenia‚Äôs Foreign Intelligence Service.

’ë’•’≤’°’Ω’∫’°’∂’°’£’´’ø’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’® ’æ’°’≤’∏÷Ç÷Å ’∫’°’ø’°’Ω’≠’°’∂’•’¨ ’ß ’Ä’°’µ’∏÷Å ÷Å’•’≤’°’Ω’∫’°’∂’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’∂ ’∫’°’ø’≥’°’º’∂’•÷Ä’´’∂. ’∂’∑’∏÷Ç’¥ ’ß ÷Å’•’≤’°’Ω’∫’°’∂’°’£’•’ø ’ç’∏÷Ç÷Ä’•’∂ ’Ñ’°’∂’∏÷Ç’Ø’µ’°’∂’®’ù ’°’∂’§÷Ä’°’§’°’º’∂’°’¨’∏’æ ÷Ö÷Ä’•÷Ä’Ω ’ë’µ’∏÷Ç÷Ä’´’≠’∏÷Ç’¥ ’Ä’°’µ’°’Ω’ø’°’∂’´ ’æ’°÷Ä’π’°’∫’•’ø’´ ’°÷Ä’°’Æ ’∞’°’µ’ø’°÷Ä’°÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’∂’•÷Ä’´’∂÷â ’Ü’° ’∂’∑’∏÷Ç’¥ ’ß, ’∏÷Ä ’ì’°’∑’´’∂’µ’°’∂’´ ’∏÷Ç’≤’•÷Ä’±’∂’•÷Ä’® ÷É’°’©’•’©’°’æ’∏÷Ä’æ’∏÷Ç’¥ ’•’∂ ’∞’°’Ø’°’º’∏÷Ç’Ω’°’Ø’°’∂’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’∂ ’Ø’∏’∂’ø’•÷Ñ’Ω’ø’∏÷Ç’¥’ù ’∫’°’µ’¥’°’∂’°’æ’∏÷Ä’æ’°’Æ ’°÷Ä’§’´ ’¶’°÷Ä’£’°÷Å’∏÷Ç’¥’∂’•÷Ä’∏’æ÷â ’ë’•’≤’°’Ω’∫’°’∂’°’£’•’ø’® ’∂’°÷á ’°’∂’§÷Ä’°’§’°’º’∂’∏÷Ç’¥ ’ß 1939-’´’∂, 1950-’°’Ø’°’∂’∂’•÷Ä’´’∂ ÷á ’∞’•’ø’°’£’° ’™’°’¥’°’∂’°’Ø’°’∞’°’ø’æ’°’Æ’∂’•÷Ä’∏÷Ç’¥ ’ë’•’≤’°’Ω’∫’°’∂’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’∂ ’∑’∏÷Ç÷Ä’ª ÷Ñ’∂’∂’°÷Ä’Ø’∏÷Ç’¥’∂’•÷Ä’´’∂÷â
